data.title: The best way to see and get to know Austin with friends
data.text: My friend and I went on a 5 mile private run tour through Downtown Austin with Lee on the first day of our five day visit to Austin. It is hands down the best way to get to know the city. Lee was fun, knowledgable and took the time to point out all the culture, history, and food that Austin has to offer. If you're visiting Austin for the first time, you owe it to yourself to do this.

data.title: Excellent overview of Austin.
data.text: I did a tour with City Running Tours of Austin in November, 2016. The tour was excellent; gave me a great overview of the city and highlighted areas I said I was interested in. The guide was very friendly and knowledgeable. I definitely recommend this tour company to anyone visiting Austin.

data.title: Earn your tacos and Lone Star! Run with Lee!
data.text: We came in from out of town for a Bachelorette party and since this was our first time in Austin, we wanted to see the city. This running tour was perfect. Lee tailors to the group and you set the pace. Lee is EXTREMELY knowledgeable of the city, takes you everywhere, and has historical and entertaining stories the whole way. Lee is a fun and interesting guy himself. Funny, music lover, marathon nut, and loves to share his experiences of the city! If you like running/exercise or just want to earn those calories you are going to consume. Book this tour. You won't regret it!

data.title: Fantastic Mix of Fun and Sweat!
data.text: Austin is such a wonderful city and being able to tour it with an expert and get a workout in...even better! We had FUN on this run. It was everything we hoped for and more. Leisurely enough that it wasn't a daunting feat after a long night of exploring the nightlife of the city, but fast paced enough to get a sweat going. Our leader Lee, was great and made us forget we were getting our jog on. We ended the run feeling accomplished and like we were part-time Austin experts. Excellent way to see the sites, with a smile on!

data.title: Fun way to see the City!  And get your exercise in!
data.text: Great Run.  Lee adjusted to our slow pace right away and was full of interesting facts and places to take us.  He is also an excellent photographer and we got pictures of our group from various places along the way within hours of the tour.  Bring your phones and your smiles!  Also, since the other group that had signed up didn't show up, Lee was willing to adjust the route and take us by an off-route attraction that we wanted to see.  We all really enjoyed the entire tour and I would do it again in a heartbeat.

data.title: No better way to know a City....
data.text:
I recently moved to Austin from San Francisco (spare me the comments on that one....) But I know from living in SF that the #1 most ultimate BEST way to get to know a City intimately is on foot. A friend of mine recommended I take a running tour with Lee and City Running Tours Austin. And that is exactly what I did. Mind you, I have not gone on a decent run in quite some time. But that did not matter. The pace was calm, the details were sharp, and I left feeling as if I knew more about Austin than most people who have lived here for years. 

Take a jog with Lee and City Running Tours Austin. You will not regret it.

data.title: An Austinite Experiencing Austin
data.text: I decided to do a City Running Tour, and being an Austinite for 25+ years, my guide, Lee, not only made it fun, but extremely informative. I would definitely recommend to anyone who wants an entertaining and unique experience of Austin!

data.title: Ms.
data.text:
Loved it! The guide was knowledgable and had a great sense of humor. A definite on your to do list!
C.J. 
NYC

data.title: Very beautiful and great place to take photos of the family.
data.text: Very beautiful and great place to take photos of the family. Love the friendly people saying hello and the carefree atmosphere.

data.title: And I thought I knew Austin!
data.text: A friend of mine suggested this run as a unique, yet relaxed, 5k in downtown Austin. Our guide was Lee and he crushed it! I learned a lot about a city I've lived and worked in since college which is saying a lot as I'm quite active. Essentially, it's a refreshing way to see the city if you're a local and a good way to get to know the city if you're new. I'd highly recommend it to anyone I know who enjoys these types of outdoor activities. Lee easily paced for our group of 4, so it was never overwhelming but was still a great weekend workout/activity. Win-win. Don't overthink it. Just do it!

data.title: You should go!!
data.text: I enjoy running & I love tours, so this was perfect! Even though I've lived in the Austin area for 7 years, I learned a lot of new things & saw areas I haven't been to before. It was a little over a 5K, which was great! The pace was very reasonable & comfortable, with walking & picture stops sprinkled in. The Downtown 5K was great & I'll definitely be going on some more tours in the future! Thank you, Lee!!

data.title: Super fun activity!
data.text: I organized a large conference in Austin and wanted to give the attendees a few options to get out of the hotel & enjoy the city. The City Running Tour - Austin was a fantastic choice! Lee was great to deal with ahead of time & even more fun in person. The participants were thrilled with the run, the pace, the tour stops, and the information they received on the tour. A serious must-do for any active group coming to Austin. I've never seen so many smiling faces after running a 5k!

data.title: Best way to see Austin and best ever running tour!
data.text: Lee is the man.  Do not miss this tour.  Fantastic.  I did this my second day in Austin and it really helped me get a feel for the place and I got some great recommendations.  Also, Lee will point out celebrities sighted in passing.

data.title: AWESOME!!!
data.text: Great way to see the city and burn some calories! Even if you're a beginner runner they do a great job of keeping pace. I highly recommend Lee if you can get him!! He is absolutely hilarious, super knowledgable of the city and can also tell you all the cool music hotspots that the locals go to. :-)

data.title: Amazing
data.text: Went on a private run with Lee, he was extremely knowledgable on the history of Austin. He made the run fun and went at my pace. Lee was a strapping young fella with who had great energy!

data.title: 5 Mile Custom Tour -- History and Nightlife
data.text: Lee, the tour guide, had a vast knowledge of all the little nuances of the city that really make you appreciate some of the local history.  He also did a nice job of taking us to places all over the city, so we could get a lay of the land.  Really personable and a highly recommended way to start a trip to Austin.  Lee will get you acclimated to the city and you'll have a good time while you are doing it.

data.title: Entertaining run and tour, and it ended with beer
data.text: I brought my brother-in-law to one of the tours when he was visiting, and we both had a great time! The pace was great and our tour guide, Lee, did a fantastic job of pointing out some of the highlights in Austin. Finally, the tour ended at Hops and Grains, which was a great stopping point on a warm spring day.

data.title: Good Beer and History Lessons
data.text: Very easy 5k run, finished at one of my favorite breweries in Austin. It was as much walking as it was running so anyone should be able to keep pace.

data.title: First time running with tour and it was amazing!
data.text: Had always thought it would be a cool idea if there were running tours of Austin, turns out there is! Attended my first tour today and had a blast. Got to see lots of Austin Landmarks all while getting a nice run in.  As an avid runner and Austin local I still found it fun to run with a group. I actually learned a few things I didnt know about downtown! Our tour guides name was Lee and was pretty cool and new a lit about the city. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who likes running and wants to explore Austin.

data.title: Great Way to See The City
data.text: My husband and I always feel like the best way to get to know a city is to run through it.  Our experience in Austin was even better with Lee as our guide.  He was smart, funny and honest.  We learned so much about the city that we didn't know since it was our first day there.  My husband was concerned that he wouldn't be able to keep up, but it was a good mix of running and walking.  I would highly recommend CRT Austin!
